    • Constructor Detail

      • Industry

        public Industry()
        A 'bare constructor' is required by JPA and this is it. However, when the new socialClass is constructed, the constructor does not automatically create a new PK entity. So we create a 'hollow' primary key which must then be populated by the caller before persisting the entity

        public Industry(Industry template)
        make a carbon copy of an industry template
        Parameters:

        public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyStringWrapper wrappedString(Industry.Selector selector,
                                                                 Stock.ValueExpression valueExpression)
        provides a wrapped version of the selected member which the display will recognise, as a ReadOnlyStringWrapper. We don't mind the hardwiring because we don't really intend this code to be re-usable, it's not hard to modify, and it results in compact and readable usage code (see (@link TabbedTableViewer.makeIndustriesViewTable())
        Parameters:
        selector - chooses which member to evaluate
        valueExpression - selects the value DisplayAsExpression where relevant (QUANTITY, VALUE, PRICE)
        Returns:
        a String representation of the members, formatted according to the relevant format string

        public boolean changed(Industry.Selector selector,
                       Stock.ValueExpression valueExpression)
        informs the display whether the selected member of this entity has changed, compared with the 'comparator' Commodity which normally comes from a different timeStamp. We don't mind the hardwiring because we don't really intend this code to be re-usable, it's not hard to modify, and it results in compact and readable usage code (see (@link TabbedTableViewer.makeIndustriesViewTable())
        Parameters:
        selector - chooses which member to evaluate
        valueExpression - selects the display attribute where relevant (QUANTITY, VALUE, PRICE)
        Returns:
        whether this member has changed or not. False if selector is unavailable here

        Returns:

      • computeDemand

        public void computeDemand(double extraOutput)
        Estimate the replenishment and expansion requirements associated with two possible levels of output, of which the first corresponds to replenishment (continuing at the existing level of output) and the second to expansion (raising output to a proposed higher level). The replenishment output level is simply that which was last used (output) while the second is the parameter expandedOutput. The replenishmentDemand of all productive stocks of this industry, including labour power, is set at a level which will deliver output. The expansionDemand of these stocks records the additional quantity of these stocks required, over and above replenishmentDemand, in order to deliver expandedOutput. Since the totals of both replenishment and expansion demand can be calculated by summing them, as can their costs, there is no return result.
        Parameters:
        extraOutput - the additional output proposed

      • replenishmentCosts

        public double replenishmentCosts()

      • currentCapital

        public double currentCapital()
        The current capital of this circult. this is the sum of all outlays (including mone), that is to say, it is everything that has to be engaged in the business to keep it going it is always calculated using the price expression of these outlays
        Returns:
        the current capital of this industry

      • persistProfit

        public void persistProfit()
        Persist the profit. Needed because the Prices phase needs to 'remember' what profits were, after revenue has been transferred to the capitalist class

      • profit

        public double profit()
        The profit of this industry. This is the current capital less the initial capital. It is thus a simple difference independent of sales, and hence makes no assumption that profit is realised. Like all capital, it is calculated using the price expression of the magnitudes involved. We used the persisted magnitude of the currentCapital member because this must be 'remembered' in order that the Prices phase can have access to it. Otherwise it would vanish when profit is transferred to the owner TODO introduce a loaned capital variable to sort this out - further down the road, however.
        Returns:
        the profit (so far) of this industry.

      • profitRate

        public double profitRate()
        Returns:
        the profitRate

      • computePossibleOutput

        public double computePossibleOutput(double extraMeansOfProduction)
        given the means of production available for investment, determine the possible level of output and then calculate the additional cost of labour power needed to achieve this. TOODO this is a rudimentary procedure written on the assumption there is only a single stock of type Means of Production. It needs to be generalised.
        Parameters:
        extraMeansOfProduction - the additional Means of Production which it is proposed this industry should acquire.
        Returns:
        the output level that can be attained by acquiring extraMeansOfProduction

      • chooseComparison

        Allocate funds for expansion
        Parameters:
        costOfExpansion - how much needs to be allocated

      • setComparator

        public void setComparator(Industry comparator)
        set the comparator Industry of this Industry. When a TableCell displays a value from this Industry, it asks the Industry to tell it whether the value has changed in comparison with another timeStamp, and by how much. The comparator allows the Industry to determine what information is provided
        Parameters:
        comparator - the comparator
